text: hey <@U13GPDA1F> I just sent you an email with the “safe zones” lmk if you need anything else!
thank you so much <@U0261PCRQ>! i’ll take a look and follow up with any questions after the lunch + learn! otherwise, ill copy you guys when sending
<@U0261PCRQ> realized that adam is also looking for some insight into gifs (in addition to image sizes) do we have a POV / reco on these:

Acceptable Image sizes (Pixels)
Image size limit (MB)
Optimal gif duration, also max and min
anything else?
this is tough. optimal gif duration is mostly a UX question (how long is a reasonable expection)
acceptable image size tends to be sub 20MB in total. BUT
we haven't tested gifs this size (tho i don't expect it to be a major factor)
ah, duration  - that totally makes sense.
apologies in advance if i have further questions on this
its cool. its hard to guess at it without throwing some examples at it
in general, we only saw performance degredation on singular images > 20MB in size
and since a gif is a packed set of single images, it would follow that as long as no single frame is greater than 20mb we'd be ok
in kooons we found that the file size (once it got up around a meg for a frame) started to drop framerate
(given the amount of time needed to decode the frame into memory)
